chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin N Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge 
Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 72 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to victim K.C. to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees. Additional restitution for State Farm is being contested by defense. Matter to be scheduled at future hearing.
AMENDED 05-25-2016:  Court sets restitution at zero ($0) for State Farm and restitution to the victim remains at $500.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with co-actors or victims listed in the complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. Maintain employment and/or school combination.
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber. Release for standard conditions. FIRST 30 days to begin forthwith. Court will allow it to be concurrent to any other municiapal committment. LAST 90 days are Stayed for use at Agent's discretion.
Concurrent with: Any Municipal Committments.

records.addlTxt:
Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Devin N Burks in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.




Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
72 Days Credit.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to anyother county.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co-Actors or victims listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Restitution in the amount of $8,657.86 requested by State Farm Insurance is being contested by the Defense.  Matter will be scheduled for a restitution hearing.

RESTITUTION:  $500 (to be paid to victim (K.C. listed in count 1)- restitution to be paid before costs or fines) - Defense is not contesting this amount.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 30 Days to be served - FORWITH - Court will allow it to be concurrent to anyother municipal comittment.
Last 90 Days - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
